Claim: A video of US President Donald Trump and a top US pharmaceutical executive speaking at a press conference has been viewed thousands of times in multiple Facebook, Twitter and YouTube posts alongside a claim that it shows them announcing a vaccine for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was “ready” to be administered.
Explaination: The claim is false; neither Trump nor the pharmaceutical executive make any reference to a vaccine being "ready" for distribution; as of March 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) states there is not yet a vaccine for COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video of US President Donald Trump and a top US pharmaceutical executive speaking at a press conference has been viewed thousands of times in multiple Facebook, Twitter and YouTube posts alongside a claim that it shows them announcing a vaccine for the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was “ready” to be administered.

Explanation:The claim is false; neither Trump nor the pharmaceutical executive make any reference to a vaccine being "ready" for distribution; as of March 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) states there is not yet a vaccine for COVID-19.

https://factcheck.afp.com/us-president-donald-trump-did-not-announce-coronavirus-vaccine-was-ready

Claim: Secretary of Health in Mexico recommends taking Vitamin C to prevent coronavirus.
Explaination: The information was disseminated by a brand of nutritional products, but it is false that taking vitamin C is a preventive measure.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Secretary of Health in Mexico recommends taking Vitamin C to prevent coronavirus.

Explanation:The information was disseminated by a brand of nutritional products, but it is false that taking vitamin C is a preventive measure.

https://spondeomedia.com/falso-la-ssa-recomienda-vitamina-c-para-prevenir-coronavirus/

Claim: Staff of Gold Coast Hospital in Australia has gifted a volleyball to Tom Hanks in quarantine.
Explaination: The image has been morphed to claim that Tom Hanks was gifted a volleyball.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Staff of Gold Coast Hospital in Australia has gifted a volleyball to Tom Hanks in quarantine.

Explanation:The image has been morphed to claim that Tom Hanks was gifted a volleyball.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/morphed-image-used-to-claim-wilson-gifted-to-tom-hanks-coronavirus-fact-check-cast-away

Claim: Of the Trump administration’s European travel restrictions that exempt the U.K.: “Well, you can just get into the Chunnel, and you’ll be in the U.K.”
Explaination: It isn't that easy to get around the restrictions by taking a train linking England and France.
Label: HALF TRUE
html:
Claim: Of the Trump administration’s European travel restrictions that exempt the U.K.: “Well, you can just get into the Chunnel, and you’ll be in the U.K.”

Explanation:It isn't that easy to get around the restrictions by taking a train linking England and France.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/12/nancy-pelosi/can-europeans-get-around-trump-travel-ban-going-en/

Claim: Deaths blamed on coronavirus are actually due to the flu.
Explaination: Fatality rates and characteristics of flu and coronavirus are different.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Deaths blamed on coronavirus are actually due to the flu.

Explanation:Fatality rates and characteristics of flu and coronavirus are different.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-Deaths-Blamed-On-Coronavirus-Are-NOT-Really-Due-To-The-Flu.html

Claim: All social media group admins are requested to close their groups for two days.
Explaination: There is no order of legal action to be taken against group admins if they don't close their groups for 2 days. There is no such restriction on citizens to share any news or updates about the coronavirus situation, as long as it is not false information.
Label: False
html:
Claim: All social media group admins are requested to close their groups for two days.

Explanation:There is no order of legal action to be taken against group admins if they don't close their groups for 2 days. There is no such restriction on citizens to share any news or updates about the coronavirus situation, as long as it is not false information.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/08/messages-claiming-legal-action-to-be-taken-against-group-admins-is-false/

Claim: A Cuban vaccine cured 1.500 people infected with the new coronavirus.
Explaination: There is still no vaccine available in the market, according to Health Authorities. Experts estimate that it will take about 18 months to develop and test a vaccine that can be used with safety in human beings.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Cuban vaccine cured 1.500 people infected with the new coronavirus.

Explanation:There is still no vaccine available in the market, according to Health Authorities. Experts estimate that it will take about 18 months to develop and test a vaccine that can be used with safety in human beings.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-vacina-cubana-curou-1-500-infetados-pelo-novo-coronavirus/

Claim: Muammar Gaddafi predicted the current coronavirus pandemic, and warned it would be created by the same people who would then sell  the “antidotes.”
Explaination: In a speech to the UN General Assembly in 2009, the late Libyan leader did speculate about the creation of viruses and express his concern about the sale of vaccines. But he did not say the quote attributed to him, and he did not "predict" coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Muammar Gaddafi predicted the current coronavirus pandemic, and warned it would be created by the same people who would then sell the “antidotes.”

Explanation:In a speech to the UN General Assembly in 2009, the late Libyan leader did speculate about the creation of viruses and express his concern about the sale of vaccines. But he did not say the quote attributed to him, and he did not "predict" coronavirus.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/no-gaddafi-didnt-predict-coronavirus-but-did-talk-about-viruses-and-vaccines/

Claim: A viral screenshot of a story allegedly published by the BBC claiming Ghana has recorded its first confirmed coronavirus case.
Explaination: It was denied by the BBC correspondent in Ghana and the Ghana Health Service. We found that the misinformers modified the HTML codes from the BBC website to create the false headline and story.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A viral screenshot of a story allegedly published by the BBC claiming Ghana has recorded its first confirmed coronavirus case.

Explanation:It was denied by the BBC correspondent in Ghana and the Ghana Health Service. We found that the misinformers modified the HTML codes from the BBC website to create the false headline and story.

https://ghanafact.com/bbc-correspondent-denies-reporting-first-coronavirus-case-in-ghana/

Claim: Indian Singer Kanika Kapoor met Prince Charles, after which he tested positive for coronavirus.
Explaination: Contrary to the claim, the viral image is not recent but from 2015, when the singer attended the Elephant Family charity ‘Travels to my Elephants’, hosted by Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian Singer Kanika Kapoor met Prince Charles, after which he tested positive for coronavirus.

Explanation:Contrary to the claim, the viral image is not recent but from 2015, when the singer attended the Elephant Family charity ‘Travels to my Elephants’, hosted by Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/2015-images-used-to-claim-kanika-kapoor-infected-prince-charles-with-covid-19

Claim: President Donald Trump tried to buy a vaccine developed in Germany.
Explaination: In an audio a woman said that Trump tried to buy a vaccine that was developed in Germany. However, the german CureVac laboratory denied the allegations on March 16.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Donald Trump tried to buy a vaccine developed in Germany.

Explanation:In an audio a woman said that Trump tried to buy a vaccine that was developed in Germany. However, the german CureVac laboratory denied the allegations on March 16.

https://elsurti.com/coronavirus-falso-vacuna-trump/

Claim: A post says the coronavirus can be slowed or stopped with the “immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.”
Explaination: The claim was originally shared on an alternative medical website that promotes nutritional supplementation.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: A post says the coronavirus can be slowed or stopped with the “immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.”

Explanation:The claim was originally shared on an alternative medical website that promotes nutritional supplementation.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/feb/29/facebook-posts/no-vitamin-c-cannot-slow-or-stop-spread-coronaviru/

Claim: Russia unleashed more than 500 lions on its streets to ensure that people are staying indoors during this pandemic outbreak.
Explaination: Russian President Vladimir Putin hasn’t resorted to releasing lions in order to keep people inside during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Russia unleashed more than 500 lions on its streets to ensure that people are staying indoors during this pandemic outbreak.

Explanation:Russian President Vladimir Putin hasn’t resorted to releasing lions in order to keep people inside during the COVID-19 pandemic.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/24/instagram-posts/no-russia-didnt-release-lions-enforce-covid-19-sta/

Claim: Australian hospital staff rolled in a Wilson volleyball to keep Tom Hanks company in quarantine.
Explaination: This came from a satire website, and the photo in the story is old and unrelated to Tom Hanks illness.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Australian hospital staff rolled in a Wilson volleyball to keep Tom Hanks company in quarantine.

Explanation:This came from a satire website, and the photo in the story is old and unrelated to Tom Hanks illness.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471894-fact-check-australian-gold-coast-hospital-staff-did-not-roll-in-a-wilson-volleyball-to-keep-tom-hanks-company-in-quaran.html

Claim: Authorities in the Philippines seize fake cigarettes that were spreading coronavirus.
Explaination: Video shows Philippine customs seizing cigarettes in May 2018.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Authorities in the Philippines seize fake cigarettes that were spreading coronavirus.

Explanation:Video shows Philippine customs seizing cigarettes in May 2018.

https://factcheck.afp.com/report-hoax-video-was-filmed-one-year-novel-coronavirus-outbreak

Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook, YouTube and Twitter posts alongside a claim it shows the Islamic call to prayer being heard in Spain during the COVID-19 epidemic for the first time in 500 years.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video was filmed in Azerbaijan in November 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic; there has been no ban on the Islamic call to prayer in Spain in recent times.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple Facebook, YouTube and Twitter posts alongside a claim it shows the Islamic call to prayer being heard in Spain during the COVID-19 epidemic for the first time in 500 years.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video was filmed in Azerbaijan in November 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic; there has been no ban on the Islamic call to prayer in Spain in recent times.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-was-filmed-azerbaijan-november-2019

Claim: Vitamin C can “stop” the new coronavirus.
Explaination: While it’s true that vitamin C can have a marginal effect on warding off a cold, there’s no evidence that it can stop or treat the new coronavirus.
Label: (Org. doesn't apply rating)
html:
Claim: Vitamin C can “stop” the new coronavirus.

Explanation:While it’s true that vitamin C can have a marginal effect on warding off a cold, there’s no evidence that it can stop or treat the new coronavirus.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/02/fake-coronavirus-cures-part-3-vitamin-c-isnt-a-shield/

Claim: Mélange Of Unrelated Videos From China Shared Misleadingly In Context To Recent Corona Virus Outbreak.
Explaination: A mix of different unrelated videos from China have been merged to create this misleading video shared in context to coronavirus. People infected by coronavirus 2019-nCoV, do not exhibit the symptoms such as howling like dogs and biting as shown in the video.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Mélange Of Unrelated Videos From China Shared Misleadingly In Context To Recent Corona Virus Outbreak.

Explanation:A mix of different unrelated videos from China have been merged to create this misleading video shared in context to coronavirus. People infected by coronavirus 2019-nCoV, do not exhibit the symptoms such as howling like dogs and biting as shown in the video.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/english/melange-of-unrelated-videos-merged-together-shared-in-context-with-coronavirus/

Claim: Muslims intentionally licking the cutlery and plates to spread COVID-19.
Explaination: People shown in the video are of Dawoodi Bohra religion and people of these community do not waste food. That is why after eating, he lick all the utensils such as plate, spoon and bowl to ensure no food wastage and then wash the vessels.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Muslims intentionally licking the cutlery and plates to spread COVID-19.

Explanation:People shown in the video are of Dawoodi Bohra religion and people of these community do not waste food. That is why after eating, he lick all the utensils such as plate, spoon and bowl to ensure no food wastage and then wash the vessels.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2019/06/15/eid-special-preparation-by-muslims-for-hindus/

Claim: An image of Indian Home Minister Amit Shah visiting COVID-19 patients.
Explaination: A 2015 picture of the then BJP president visiting hospitals in Madhya Pradesh shared with a false narrative.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image of Indian Home Minister Amit Shah visiting COVID-19 patients.

Explanation:A 2015 picture of the then BJP president visiting hospitals in Madhya Pradesh shared with a false narrative.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/2015-photo-falsely-shared-as-amit-shah-visiting-covid-19-patients-7380?check=1

Claim: The WHO has issued a protocol for lockdown extension providing a relaxation period of five days.
Explaination: The viral message is false and no such protocol has been issued by WHO as a lockdown Standard schedule.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The WHO has issued a protocol for lockdown extension providing a relaxation period of five days.

Explanation:The viral message is false and no such protocol has been issued by WHO as a lockdown Standard schedule.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/06/fact-check-who-proposes-a-relaxation-period-for-5-days-between-and-after-the-21-day-lockdown/

Claim: In an Ethiopian Airlines flight from Italy to Addis Ababa airport this evening, most of the passengers are infected with the virus, and there is no strength except in God.
Explaination: The visuals actually pertain to a mock rescue drill that took place at Blaise Diagne Airport near the town of Diass, Senegal. The incident dates back to 28 November 2019 and was a simple simulation aimed at evaluating the capacity to respond to various crises that may arise during airport operations.
Label: False
html:
Claim: In an Ethiopian Airlines flight from Italy to Addis Ababa airport this evening, most of the passengers are infected with the virus, and there is no strength except in God.

Explanation:The visuals actually pertain to a mock rescue drill that took place at Blaise Diagne Airport near the town of Diass, Senegal. The incident dates back to 28 November 2019 and was a simple simulation aimed at evaluating the capacity to respond to various crises that may arise during airport operations.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/video-of-rescue-drill-shared-as-passengers-infected-with-covid-19

Claim: Does vaping reduce your chances of getting the coronavirus?
Explaination: There aren't a ton of studies on the link between vaping and COVID-19 specifically, but there is enough evidence that smoking certainly wouldn't help. Vaping could increase your risk of coronavirus infection since experts say that smoking suppresses immune function.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Does vaping reduce your chances of getting the coronavirus?

Explanation:There aren't a ton of studies on the link between vaping and COVID-19 specifically, but there is enough evidence that smoking certainly wouldn't help. Vaping could increase your risk of coronavirus infection since experts say that smoking suppresses immune function.

https://youtu.be/zOc0QEqEIzk

Claim: 5G Technology Believed To Have Caused coronavirus
Explaination: The claim is false, not backed by scientific research, and many dates given to back up the theory are wrong or misleading.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: 5G Technology Believed To Have Caused coronavirus

Explanation:The claim is false, not backed by scientific research, and many dates given to back up the theory are wrong or misleading.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472004-fact-check-5g-technology-not-believed-to-have-caused-coronavirus.html

Claim: Most of the passengers in an Ethiopian airlines flight from Italy are infected with coronavirus.
Explaination: The viral video is of a mock drill from Senegal.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Most of the passengers in an Ethiopian airlines flight from Italy are infected with coronavirus.

Explanation:The viral video is of a mock drill from Senegal.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-crisis-management-mock-drill-video-linked-to-coronavirus-goes-viral-1-1172973.html
